reviews.review_msg: He lectured that it would be gone over your head. The style of teaching is not friendly. It is like one way of talking.

I haven't completed this course yet, but giving a heads-up to all future students. I don't usually come like this and rate someone but do not take him. If you have a choice, take the other professor. It's one thing to be a tough grader,but another thing to not provide information and training about expectations and no logical feedback after results
Thank you, next

If you want to risk your grades and fail can select this professor. He make sure that your life is made a hell and you are failed from the course. How much you write for the assignment he never bothers to give more than the average of 60. Never ever recommend him for any student. Especially if you are on scholarship and wants good grades.

After the first month, you would just want to go back in time and change your decision of choosing him as your instructor. He will make sure to make your life a living hell with boring lectures and low grades.
To all the future students, DO NOT take his class.
He is the Albert Einstein, who has successfully formulated a formula to fail students.

The worst professor you can select. It is understandable that you as a student would want to learn but at the cost of failing? The professor will give you worst grades no matter how much effort you put to your assignments.
I would highly recommend to not take this professor even if you don't find any other options to opt for.

The teacher transmits tranquillity during the classes. He is a calm and experienced gentleman. He likes to talk and share his experiences. He does not force you to participate in class, but he recommends you to do so. There are individual and group quizzes and assignments, but nothing too heavy. I would take his class again.

His lectures are good, but he is extremely strict about giving grades. It's difficult to build trust, and it creates a very stressful atmosphere, especially at the end of the term, as you have no idea if you're going to pass, despite having done everything and given your best.
Very tough grader.If you want to experience too much stress about your grades in your whole semester then you can take this professor.
Lectures are good but he will make you run for even a single mark, sometimes unreasonably, and, you need to be an Einstein to get a "B". Take someone else if grades are your main focus.

Yes he is tough grader, then how are you gonna learn the real content of the subject. This course is really important after you compete your course, the study will help you in your leadership skills. If he not tough grader how will you learn the subject. Yes I agree sometimes its demotivating. But we try to do best our best.
Very clear feedback, enjoyed every class even though it was at 8 am in the winter :)

Don't take this guy. His criteria of grading is awful. On top of that he will keep on making everything hard like he kept on narrowing the timelines, depleted the quiz timings and what not. In the class he keeps on sharing his experiences which take him away from the topics. Would never ever take him again.

The professor is an excellent human being. But a bad teacher, he doesn't know how to teach. Always starts talking about some past experience and lose focus on the class. He don't follow any kind of syllabus or schedule.

Marc as a human is SUPER kind & respectful. However, his skills as a TA are poor to non existent. Did not give part marks on the midterm, did not show us them in tut when prof said he would, came to lecture late with coffee spilled on them, and provided no clarity within marking. Tutorials consisted of him rambling about his life and experiences.
Such a tough grader. It takes forever for him to grade papers and you wouldn't know your standing until the last few weeks of the term.  Bye for now!
Literally the sweetest human on earth. Dont know how anyone could dislike the guy

Marc is a really wholesome awesome guy, people give him a hard time because he is a little bit of a hard marker but that is it. He truly cares about his students and I for one really enjoyed having him!

Students don't like him because of the way he gives grades. Experience-wise, he is well-versed in his field. I like him as a Professor, but the grading is another thing. We passed the course, which is the most important, though.

Do not take this professor! He is teaching like he understands everyone, but the thing is he will not grade you well. Even though you already exerted so much effort, there is no way you can get higher grades from him. If ever you have this professor, auto drop!
He is the worst professor I have seen in my academic journey.

He is full of life experiences, never sticks to one topic. students in the class tend to loose focus in his teaching style. Very tough grader, unless you are ready to justify every statement in your assignment with 'Why' and 'How'. He didn't post the marks till last day, so no option to know where you stand throughout the term.

He does not give feedback, feels threatened when students ask him questions and acquire a defensive posture.
It was a Leadership class for an MBA, with poor class content, a lack of inspirational managerial illustrative examples, and practical exercises. He dictated the Leadership class by repeating the textbook.

Marc is probably the nicest prof i have ever had. However, he gave no clear rubrics for assignemtns and said everything was based on our own learning. Which confused me since he gave everyone bad marks. I took this class as a GPA booster and it did not boost my gpa in any means. Do not take a course with him since he releases all marks at end

He's probably the nicest prof I've had. But his class was such a mess! We were always lost on what to do on our assignments, which he gave very broad instructions for and never gave any feedback. Gave us our marks for assignments at the very end not knowing how our progress was. Disappointing, considering how nice and friendly he was.

Marc was my TA for EDUC445 and he is genuinely caring & kind. He really really wants the best for us students and that is a rare quality to come across from a TA. I am forever grateful for him and will always remember how helpful and concerned he was when I needed advice and assistance for my individual paper. Thank you Marc if you ever read this!
